events.title: Execution of King Louis XVI of France
events.description: King Louis XVI was executed by guillotine in Paris after being convicted of treason during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Marked the definitive end of the monarchy in France and intensified revolutionary conflicts in Europe.

events.title: Death of Vladimir Lenin
events.description: Vladimir Lenin, the Russian revolutionary leader and head of the Soviet state, died.
events.significance: His death led to a power struggle that eventually brought Joseph Stalin to power.

events.title: The Great Gatsby Published
events.description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel 'The Great Gatsby' was published in the United States.
events.significance: It became an iconic work of American literature highlighting themes of decadence, idealism, and social upheaval.

events.title: First commercial Concorde flight
events.description: The Concorde supersonic airliner began its first commercial flights, revolutionizing air travel speed.
events.significance: It represented a major advancement in aviation technology despite its eventual commercial challenges.

events.title: First Female Speaker of the UK House of Commons
events.description: Following the UK general election, Andrea Leadsom was a notable candidate, though ultimately, the first female Speaker was elected previously in 2009 (Note: This is a correction; the first female Speaker was Betty Boothroyd in 1992, not a 2017 event).
events.significance: Reflects ongoing progress towards gender equality in political leadership roles.
